structure.summary:
The partial document provides details about non-derivative securities transactions, specifically common stock. It includes information such as transaction date, transaction code, amount of securities acquired or disposed of, price per share, and ownership form (direct or indirect). The main points covered in the document are:

1. Listing of non-derivative securities transactions involving common stock
2. Details about the transaction date, transaction code, and amount of securities
3. Price per share for each transaction
4. Ownership form for each transaction (direct or indirect)
5. Total amount of beneficially owned common stock following reported transactions for direct ownership.

structure.title: Table II - Derivative Securities Acquired, Disposed of, or Beneficially Owned (e.g., puts, calls, warrants, options, convertible securities)
structure.text:
## Table II - Derivative Securities Acquired, Disposed of, or Beneficially Owned (e.g., puts, calls, warrants, options, convertible securities)
1. Title of Derivative Security (Instr.
      3) | 2. Conversion or Exercise Price of Derivative Security | 3. Transaction Date
      (Month/Day/Year) | 3A. Deemed Execution Date, if any
      (Month/Day/Year) | 4. Transaction Code (Instr.
      8) | 5.
      Number of Derivative Securities Acquired (A) or Disposed of (D) (Instr.
      3, 4 and 5) | 6. Date Exercisable and Expiration Date
      (Month/Day/Year) | 7. Title and Amount of Securities Underlying Derivative Security (Instr.
      3 and 4) | 8. Price of Derivative Security (Instr.
      5) | 9.
      Number of derivative Securities Beneficially Owned Following Reported Transaction(s) (Instr.
      4) | 10. Ownership Form: Direct (D) or Indirect (I) (Instr.
      4) | 11. Nature of Indirect Beneficial Ownership (Instr.
      4)
Code | V | (A) | (D) | Date Exercisable | Expiration Date | Title | Amount or Number of Shares
Employee Stock Options | $ 151.12 | 02/02/2026 |  | M |  |  | 20,512 | (2) | 03/05/2028 | Common Stock | 20,512 | $ 151.12 | 0 | D |

Explanation of Responses:
1. This transaction was executed in multiple trades at prices ranging from $682.93 to $683.49. The price reported above reflects the weighted average sale price. The reporting person hereby undertakes to provide upon request to the SEC staff, the issuer or a security holder of the issuer full information regarding the number of shares and prices at which the transaction was effected.
2. The stock options were granted pursuant to the Caterpillar Inc. 2014 Long-Term Incentive Plan on March 5, 2018 and vest equally in 1/3 increments in the first, second and thired anniversaries of the grant date.

 | /s/ Nicole Puza, POA for Bob De Lange | 02/03/2026
 | ** Signature of Reporting Person | Date
Reminder: Report on a separate line for each class of securities beneficially owned directly or indirectly.
* If the form is filed by more than one reporting person, see Instruction
                  4

                  (b)(v).
** Intentional misstatements or omissions of facts constitute Federal Criminal Violations See 18 U.S.C. 1001 and 15 U.S.C. 78ff(a).
Note: File three copies of this Form, one of which must be manually signed. If space is insufficient, see Instruction 6 for procedure.
Persons who respond to the collection of information contained in this form are not required to respond unless the form displays a currently valid OMB Number.
structure.summary:
The partial document provides details about derivative securities transactions, specifically employee stock options. The main points covered in the document are:

1. Title of Derivative Security: Employee Stock Options
2. Price of Derivative Security: $151.12
3. Number of Derivative Securities Acquired: 0 (no acquisition, but disposal of 20,512 shares)
4. Date Disposed of: 02/02/2026
5. Date Exercisable and Expiration Date: 03/05/2028 and 03/05/2028 respectively
6. Underlying Securities: Common Stock
7. Number of Shares underlying Derivative Security: 20,512
8. The stock options were granted pursuant to the Caterpillar Inc. 2014 Long-Term Incentive Plan on March 5, 2018 and vest equally in 1/3 increments in the first, second and third anniversaries of the grant date.
9. Ownership Form: Direct (D)
10. Signature of Reporting Person: Nicole Puza, POA for Bob De Lange on 02/03/2026
11. Reminder to report each class of securities beneficially owned directly or indirectly separately and follow instructions for multiple reporting persons if applicable.
12. Intentional misstatements or omissions of facts constitute Federal Criminal Violations.
13. Persons who respond to the collection of information contained in this form are not required to respond unless the form displays a currently valid OMB Number.
